result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:53 AM Defendant Colten A Weber in court.  Attorney Kathleen A Lindgren in court for Colten A Weber. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by District Attorney's Office Intern Julian Marrufo. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense filed a discovery demand, does not have an offer yet, and requests a date in 30 days. Courts sets.

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Colten A Weber in court.   

Court advises of right to an attorney.
Defendant doesn't qualify for Public Defender Represention - Based on his wife's income - However, his wife kicked him out of the marritial home, and he is currently living in his car.
Defendant is requesting the court appoint counsel.
Court Swears in the Defendant and conducts colloquy.
Court Grants - Appointments of Counsel.
Court to Appoint Counsel.
Defendant to post $25 per month, starting 08/15/22.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 7th, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

01:59 PM Defendant Colten A Weber in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant was seen by SPD, however more investigation needs to be done before they can say he qualifies.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
